Authors:
Vasily I Radashevsky, Victoria V Pankova, Tatyana V
Neretina, Alexandra N Stupnikova, Alexander B Tzetlin
Title:
Molecular identity and morphology of Pygospio elegans with a
diagnosis of the genus Pygospio (Annelida: Spionidae)
Abstract:
Pygospio elegans ClaparÃ¨de, 1863, the type species of the
genus Pygospio, originally described from Normandy, France, has later
been widely reported from boreal waters in the northern hemisphere.
Sequence data of four gene fragments (2585 bp in total) of the
mitochondrial 16S rDNA, nuclear 18S and 28S rDNA, and Histone 3 have
shown that individuals from California, Oregon, Scotland and the White
Sea were genetically similar (the average p-distances between the four
groups ranged from 0.08 to 0.19%). These individuals are considered to
be conspecific and the amphiboreal distribution of P. elegans is here
confirmed. Adult morphology of the species is briefly described and
illustrated. The diagnosis of the genus Pygospio is emended to include
P. elegans, P. californica Hartman, 1936 and a third undescribed species
from Oregon recognized in the present study. It is suggested that the
taxonomy of Pygospio muscularis Ward, 1981 and Pseudopolydora primigenia
Blake, 1983 should be revised based on phylogenetic analysis of
morphological and molecular characteristics of Pygospio and
Pseudopolydora species.
